ChunkText: you will need to print the signed i-20, sign it in ink with a blue pen, and then take that physical document to your visa appointment. you will carry this document with you through immigration as well. if i defer my admission to a new semester, do i need a new i-20?
ContextBefore: please review the uploaded I-20 to verify that all of the information is correct. if your I-20 requires any changes, please submit a help ticket and let us know. can i use this electronic copy of a signed I-20 to apply for a visa? yes, all i-20s are issued electronically by our office.
ContextAfter: what if i will attend my first semester remotely from home? your I-20 has a program start date that must reflect the first semester you will be physically on umbcs campus.
